A file x is created with the following contents echo today is date If you type x.then

Options.Option: It echoes the message followed by the date
It gives the desired output only if the execute permission of the file x is set
The desired output can be got by the command sh x. which works even if file x has its execute permission not set

Test.Explaination: Wrong:Correct answer is option 4. When you create a file using an editor, it will be assign default permission setting (determined by the unmask value). Generally the execute permission will be off.So to run a shell script, set its execute bit on. However, if you run sh x, then fill x will be executed even if its execute bit is off.

Test.Question: Which of the following metacharecters will be recognized by the shell even if it comes within double quotes?
The number of errors in the following shell script echo How r you? read $answer is -
Test.Explaination: Wrong:Correct answer is option 3 Two mistakes. First is the "?" in echo. It is a metacharacter. So when shell encounters "?" it will try for a match, With the files in the current directory. made up of just one character. Use ? , to supress the special meaning of ?. Second mistake is - $answer means the value of the variable answer. Since you are reading a value of the variable answer , it should be read answer

Test.Explaination: Wrong:Correct answer is option 1. The point is to understand that wc counts lines, that grep selects lines where a pattern is present.
